case_vignette: An 18-day-old newborn has difficulty feeding and diarrhea for 2 days! During this period he has vomited after each of his feeds! He was born at 28 weeks' gestation and weighed 1100-g (2-lb 7-oz)! His feeds consist of breast milk and cow milk based-formula! He appears lethargic! His temperature is 36!4°C (97!5°F), pulse is 120/min, respirations are 67/min and blood pressure is 70/35 mm Hg! Examination shows diffuse abdominal tenderness; rigidity and guarding are present! Bowel sounds are absent! Test of the stool for occult blood is positive! His hemoglobin concentration is 12!8 g/dL, leukocyte count is 18,000/mm3 and platelet count is 78,000/mm3! An x-ray of the abdomen is shown!
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Pediatrics and Neonatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have difficulty feeding and diarrhea, and I vomit after each feed. I also feel very tired.
How old are you?
I am 18 days old.
Do you experience excessive crying or irritability, especially after feeding?
Yes, I vomit after each of my feeds.
Is there any family history of gastrointestinal diseases or allergies?
I don't know about any family history of gastrointestinal diseases or allergies.
Have you noticed any blood in the vomit or stools?
Yes, there is blood in my stool.
Final Diagnosis: Allergic colitis
